332682.「ほえっ？ そなたは どこの誰かね。\n ワガハイは 何を隠そう 精霊大臣である: What? Who are you? My name is Spirit Minister.

332683.「そなたは 精霊ではないな。\n 誰のゆるしを得て ここに来たのか？\n ほれ:
You are not a spirit. Who gave you permission
to come here? Come on, tell me.

332684.<pc>は 精霊大臣に\n陰者ブロズに挑む 隠者パンメッポの使いとして\nチカラ:
<pc> told the Spirit Minister that
he had come to borrow help from Panmeppo to
challenge Brohz.

332685.「おお パンメッポちゃんの使いか。\n ならば 苦しゅうないぞ。\n ワガハイの:
Oh, Pammeppo sent you? Then I have no pain.
You ask for my help.

332686.「ふむむ～。貸してやってもよいのだが\n タダというわけには いかんぞな。:
Hmmm~. I'd be happy to lend them to you, but
it won't be for free.

332687.「ワガハイは 精霊王の次にエラい\n 精霊大臣であるからして\n チカラの安売り:
We are the most powerful Spirit Minister next
to the King of Spirits, and we will not sell
our power cheaply.

332688.「おっ。いいことを思いついてしもうた！\n じつは 食べてみたい 俗世の食べ物が:
Oops. I just thought of a good idea! Actually, there is a food from the mundane world that I would like to try. Would you prepare it for
me?

332689.「焼いた肉を パンで はさみまくった\n ワイルドかつ ジャンクな料理だ。\n:
It is a wild and janky dish made of grilled meat and breaded bread, and is supposed to be eaten while watching the battle at the
Coliseum.

332690.「なんでも 鉄道の駅とやらで 買えると聞く。\n ひとつでいいので 持ってきてく:
I hear you can buy anything at a train station
or something. Please bring me just one of
them! I'll lend you a hand.

332691.「私の生み出した 精霊獣が\n お前の倒した １体だけだと思っていたのなら\n:
If you thought that the spirit beast I created
was the only one you defeated, then I must say
that you are not thinking very well.

332693.「このような深刻な事態でも あの人は\n お前に託すのみで 何もしないのだな。\:
Even in a serious situation like this, he only
entrusts you to do nothing. He is really
thorough.

332694.「私に言わせれば 無責任 極まりない。\n 世界を救う手立てと それを達成できる:
In my opinion, it is irresponsible. If you
have a way to save the world and the power to
accomplish it, you should do it yourself.

332695.「それこそが 正しい考えであることを\n これから 証明してみせよう。:
I will now prove to you that this is the right
idea.

332696.「精霊から得た このチカラで\n 私は 世界を汚染する人類を排除する。\n そう:
With this power I have gained from the spirits, I will rid the world of the human race that is polluting it. Then the world will
be saved.

332697.「お前は 自分が今\n どこにいるのか 理解しているか？: Do you understand where you are right now?

332698.「ここは 自然再生の役目を果たした 精霊たちの\n 住まう世界と 我々の暮らす:
This is the interface between the real world where we live and the world inhabited by spirits who have fulfilled their role as
regenerators of nature, a place we can call the border.

332699.「精霊のチカラを得た 今の私ならば\n この先…… 精霊の世界の深奥にも\n た:
Now that I have the power of the spirit, I can
reach the depths of the spirit world.

332700.「そこには 高次な存在に至り\n 絶大なチカラを持った 精霊の王が\n 存在する:
It is said that there exists a king of spirits
who has reached a higher existence and
possesses immense power.

332701.「私は 精霊の王すらも屈服させ\n すべての精霊を 意のままに操るチカラを\n:
I will bring even the king of spirits to his
knees, and I will have the power to control
all spirits at my will.

332702.「そして 現実世界で 自然再生に使われる\n 精霊のチカラを 人類への攻撃に 向:
Then, the power of the spirits used to regenerate nature in the real world will be directed to attack mankind. Humanity will not
be able to withstand it and will be extinguished.

332703.「だが その前に……。\n 邪魔者を 排除する必要がある。:
But first... We need to get rid of the
obstacles in our way.

332704.「これが 精霊のチカラか……。: So this is the power of the spirits...

332705.「この姿で 陰者を名乗るのは おかしいか？\n ならば 精霊も人も超えた存在……:
Is it strange for me to call myself a Yinja in this form? Then let's call him a being that transcends both spirits and humans... Let's
call him a spirit superhuman.

332706.「戦闘力を測る よい機会だ。\n 精霊の王の前に まずは\n お前を 屈服させる:
This is a good opportunity to gauge your
fighting skills. First, I will bring you to
your knees before the King of Spirits.

332707.どこからともなく\n隠者パンメッポの声が 聞こえてきた。: Panmeppo's voice came out of nowhere.

332708.「<cs_pchero>よ。\n こやつは 精霊の守りを得ている。:
<cs_pchero>. This one has the protection of
the spirits.

332709.「最初の試練を 思いだすのじゃ。\n こちらも 精霊に頼る必要があるぞ！:
Remember the first trial. You will need to
rely on the spirits as well!

332711.「こんなキモチ悪いやつ やっつけちゃって！\n ……あっ。あたしは 見てるだけだ:
You should have killed this bad guy! Ah... I'm
just watching.

332712.「へへっ。強そうな相手だな……。\n こいつは 気合を入れていかないと\n マズ:
Hehe. Looks like a strong opponent... I'm
going to have to be really hardcore about this
one!

332713.「大臣から借りたチカラ 『精霊の威厳』が\n ここぞというところで 使えるはず。:
The power "Spirit's Grandeur" borrowed from the Minister can be used at the right moment. You will fight by blocking the movements of
the enemy spirits!

332714.「隠者め。姿は見せずとも\n 手助けには しゃしゃり出てくるか。\n 無駄なこと:
HERMIT. You don't show yourselves, but you
still get in the way of helping. I'll have you
know in a moment that it's all for naught!

332715.「精霊のチカラを得た私を 超える……だと。:
I have the power of the spirit, and it
surpasses me...

332716.<cs_pchero>の背後から\n隠者パンメッポの声が 聞こえてきた。:
Panmeppo's voice could be heard from behind
<cs_pchero>.

332718.「おぬしは 精霊に 無理をさせすぎた。\n これ以上 チカラを借りようとしても\:
You have overworked the spirits. Even if you
try to borrow more power, the spirits will no
longer respond.

332719.「なぜだ……。なぜ 邪魔をする。\n 己の繁栄にのみ 目を向け 自然への感謝の念:
Why... Why are you interfering? Humanity is not worth protecting if it is so focused on its own prosperity that it forgets to be
grateful to nature.

332720.「人は 他の生き物のように\n 精霊を 生みだすことはない。\n 自然の流れから:
People do not give birth to spirits like other
creatures. We are beings deviating from the
flow of nature.

332721.「その考えは 正しくないぞ。\n 人も その営みも 自然の一部であると知れ。:
That is not correct. Know that people and
their activities are part of nature.

332722.「人が 自然を破壊する……。\n たしかに その一面は あるじゃろうて。\n じ:
People destroy nature. Yes, that is one
aspect. But we must not be obsessed with this.

332724.「ウェナ諸島にある 波紋の音叉を知っとるか？\n かの地の かつての王が その知:
Do you know the tuning fork of ripples in the Wena Islands? The former kings of these lands used to build them with their knowledge and
efforts.

332725.「その音叉は ヴェリナード王の歌う\n 恵みの歌を増幅して 海に 恵みをもたらす:
The tuning fork amplifies the song of grace sung by King Verinard and brings blessings to the sea. It helps to increase the number of
spirits.

332726.「そして 人は 植物や 動物を育てる。\n 腹を満たすために 必要なことであって:
And people grow plants and animals. It may be
necessary to fill our bellies, but it may not
be out of concern for nature.

332727.「じゃが 麦が 大きく 元気に育てば\n そこからは 精霊たちも 生まれてくる。:
But if the wheat grows large and vigorous,
then the spirits will be born from it. We are
not just consuming spirits.

332728.「あなたの言う面も 認めてもいい。\n だが そうして 人類が生みだすよりも速く:
I can accept your side of the story. But then
again, spirits are dwindling in numbers faster
than mankind can create them!

332729.「ブロズよ。おぬしは\n 人の感覚でしか 時を見ておらん。\n 世界の流れは も:
Broz. You see time only in human terms. The
world moves more slowly.

332730.「この畑の世話をする者たちを よく見るのじゃ。\n 小さな……。本当に 小さな精:
Look closely at those who take care of these
fields. Little... Do you see the little
spirits that are really born from them?

332732.「おぬしは 人からは 精霊は生まれんと\n 思っておったようじゃが それは ちが:
You thought that spirits could not be born
from human beings, but that is not true.

332733.「人から生まれる精霊たちは 小さいが\n その者の人生の歩みとともに 生まれつづ:
The spirits that are born from a person are small, but they continue to be born as that person progresses through life. Do you have
any idea how many of them there are?

332734.「おお……。見える…………。\n 人々からも 精霊が…… なんということだ。:
Oh... I can see... Spirits from the people...
Oh, my God.

332735.「私は 取り返しのつかないことを\n するところだった……。: I was about to do something irreversible...

332736.「あやまちは 正せばよい。\n おぬしも 自然の流れの一部なのじゃから。:
Correct your mistakes. You are part of the
flow of nature.

332737.「わしは 人々が自然を害することで\n 世界が過剰に 滅びに傾かぬよう\n この:
I will continue to see to it that the world
doesn't become excessively doomed by people
harming nature.

332738.「しかし そのすべてを見渡すことは 難しい。\n ここにいる <cs_pcher:
But it is difficult to see it all. I trust
that the young people here <cs_pchero> and
others will realize and correct themselves.

332740.「ならば 見届けさせてもらおう。\n 隠者パンメッポよ。あなたの言うことが\n:
Then let us see, Panmeppo. I will see if what
you say will be fulfilled in the future.

332741.「うむ。見届けようではないか。\n お互い この世から 去るまではな。:
Hmmm. Let's see what happens. Until we both
leave this world.

332742.「せいぜい 長生きすればいい。\n 私は 再び 陰に潜ろう。:
Live long at best. I'll go back into the
shadows.

332743.「やれやれ……。これで 万事解決じゃな。\n <cs_pchero>よ。たいした:
Oh dear... I guess that settles everything. . You're a good man. If it weren't for you, I don't know what would have
happened.

332744.「さあ。わしの家に 戻るとしよう。\n その活躍に 報いねばならんからな。:
Come on. Let's go back to my house. I must
reward you for your service.

332745.「<cs_pchero>様 お疲れさまでした。\n あなたのご活躍には この私も:
<cs_pchero> Thank you for your hard work. I,
too, can't stop being moved by your success.

332746.「これで オイラたちは お役ごめんか。\n もっと <cs_pchero>と 一:
I guess we're done now. I wish I could have
gone to more places with <cs_pchero>.

332747.「わがまま 言わないの！\n さあ パンメッポ様の所へ 帰りましょ。\n <cs:
Don't be selfish! Come on, let's go back to
Master Pammeppo. <cs_pchero> Take me with
you!
